column5: LONDON A weaker European diesel market  where strong demand will be  trumped by abundant supply from outside the region  will hit refining margins and the price of Brent crude  Goldman Sachs said in a report.

column4: UK's Pets at Home upbeat as profits rise
column5: LONDON  June 4 Britain's biggest pet shop group Pets at Home said trading in its new fiscal year had begun in line with forecasts as it posted a 10 percent rise in full-year earnings.

column5: ZURICH/GENEVA HSBC agreed on Thursday to pay Geneva authorities 40 million Swiss francs ($43 million) to settle a money laundering investigation at its Swiss private bank  one of a number of probes facing its Geneva-based wealth manager.

column4: JM Smucker's profit misses estimates on higher coffee costs
column5: J.M. Smucker Co  reported a lower-than-expected quarterly profit  hurt by higher green coffee costs  and the company said it was offering discounts on its Folgers coffee to revive sales volumes  which plunged after price hikes last year.

column5: June 4 J.M. Smucker Co reported a quarterly loss  hurt by higher green coffee costs and lower U.S. demand for its coffee products after it raised prices.

column4: Lockheed wins $920 million deal for early work on next F-35 jet order
column5: WASHINGTON Lockheed Martin Corp  has won a contract valued at $920 million to start buying materials and parts for a tenth batch of 94 F-35 fighter jets  the Pentagon announced Thursday.

column4: Merck accused of stonewalling in mumps vaccine antitrust lawsuit
column5: Two former Merck & Co Inc scientists accusing the drugmaker of falsifying tests of its exclusive mumps vaccine said in a court filing on Monday that Merck is refusing to respond to questions about the efficacy of the vaccine.

column4: Fracking not a 'widespread risk' to drinking water: U.S. EPA
column5: WASHINGTON Fracking for shale oil and gas has not led to widespread pollution of drinking water  a U.S. Environmental Protection Agency draft report said on Thursday  although it warned some drilling activities could potentially cause health risks.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. FDA panel backs female libido drug  with conditions
column5: WASHINGTON  June 4 A drug to treat low female sexual desire should be approved with strict measures in place to ensure patients are fully aware of its risks  an advisory panel to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration concluded on Thursday.
